cards.calloutText:
BONUS: On this week's Lever Time Premium, our extended weekly podcast for supporting subscribers, The Lever‚Äôs Joel Warner interviews journalist and author Joel Stein about his recent book In Defense of Elitism: Why I'm Better Than You and You are Better Than Someone Who Didn't Buy This Book ‚Äî a humorous and self-deprecating defense of intellectual elitism and why it might actually be worth preserving.

To get access to Lever Time Premium and all of its bonus content, go here.

sections: In the new episode of our  weekly podcast
‚Äôs Julia Rock sits down with journalist and filmmaker Blake Zeff to discuss his new documentary
, which details the history of America‚Äôs student debt crisis, which politicians are to blame, and how student debt has impacted Americans across the country (30:24).
In addition, David Sirota is joined by

global economics correspondent Peter S. Goodman to explore why President Biden and the Democrats chose to side with railroad barons by forcing rail workers to accept a contract they had already rejected. They also dig into why the rail workers‚Äô demand for additional paid sick days became such a sticking point in negotiations, and what a potential rail strike could mean for the U.S. economy (6:24).
for a rough transcript of the episode.

We hope you enjoy our weekly podcast ‚Äî it‚Äôs the next step in our plan to build a powerful independent voice to take on corporate media.
